column2: WV DMV PERMIT TEST
column6: WV

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column6: Sudden stops.
column8: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 2. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column6: school crossings.
column8: possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 3. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
column6: Service signs
column8: Destination signs (guide signs)

column2: 4. This sign means:
column6: Hairpin corner ahead.
column8: Sharp right turn ahead.

column2: 5. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column6: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.
column8: travelling on HOV lanes.

column2: 6. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column6: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column8: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column10: find a safe place to stop for a break.

column2: 7. This sign means:
column6: Wrong way; Turn around immediately.
column8: 270 degree turn ahead.

column2: 8. When you approach a railroad crossing, but you do not see a train. You must stop:
column4: if the crossing lights are flashing.
column6: if a crossing gate is lowered.
column8: if a stop sign is posted.

column2: 9. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column6: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.
column8: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.

column2: 10. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column6: aggressive driving.
column8: closetailing.

column2: 11. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column6: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.
column8: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column10: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 12. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column6: Edge line
column8: Diamond

column2: 13. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column6: The driver on the left.
column8: The last driver to reach the intersection.
column10: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column6: Do not enter
column8: You must come to a complete stop
column10: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column6: Wrong Way
column8: Steep grade ahead

column2: 16. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 17. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
column6: the left side
column8: either side

column2: 18. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column6: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.
column8: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column10: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column6: No turns are allowed on this road
column8: Right lane closed

column2: 20. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column6: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column8: be ready to brake sharply and stop.

column2: 21. Your BAC depends on:
column6: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column8: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 22. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.
column8: signal the train to stop.

column2: 23. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column6: must go to the next intersection.
column8: must turn into its right lane.
column10: must turn into its left lane.

column2: 24. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column6: The car approaching from the right.
column8: The car approaching from the left.
column10: The car that is traveling faster.

column2: 25. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column6: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column8: look for a human flagger.
column10: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
